sen.j: 吾平津媛（あひらつひめ）は、神武天皇の妃。
sen.e: Ahiratsuhime (吾平津姫) was the wife of Emperor Jinmu.
sen.cmt: 吾平津媛→Ahiratsuhime (吾平津姫) と漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: Ahiratsuhime (吾平津姫) was the wife of Emperor Jinmu.
Ahiratsuhime (吾平津姫) was the wife of Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 『古事記』では阿比良比売（あひらひめ）。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was mentioned as Ahirahime (阿比良比売).
sen.cmt: 阿比良比売（あひらひめ）→Ahirahime (阿比良比売)と漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was mentioned as Ahirahime (阿比良比売).
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was mentioned as Ahirahime (阿比良比売).
She was the smaller sister of Atanoobashi.
She was a younger sister of Atanoobashi.
sen.cmt: the smaller sister を a younger sister に変更
sen.e: She was a younger sister of Atanoobashi.

sen.j: 神武天皇日向在住時に嫁し、手研耳命と岐須美美命を生んだ。
sen.e: While Emperor Jinmu was living in Hyuga Province, she became the wife of Emperor Jinmu and had two sons, Tagishimimi no mikoto and Kisumimi no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 手研耳命：統一用語リストにはTagishi-miminomikoto、とありましたがTagishimimi no mikotoとしました（岐須美美命→Kisumimi no mikotoの表記に合わせて）。
sen.e: While Emperor Jinmu was living in Hyuga Province, she became the wife of Emperor Jinmu and had two sons, Tagishimimi no mikoto and Kisumimi no mikoto.
While Emperor Jinmu was living in Hyuga Province, she became the wife of Emperor Jinmu and had two sons, Tagishimimi no mikoto and Kisumimi no mikoto.
